text: hi my name is avery Hartman's I'm a tech
reporter here at Business Insider we got
the chance to try out snapchat
spectacles which our camera equipped
glasses that you wear on your face
they're both sunglasses and they record
video that you can upload directly to
your snapchat so at first glance I was
really impressed by the glasses they
look just like regular sunglasses in my
opinion the only way that you're able to
tell that they're not regular sunglasses
is the big yellow circles in the corner
otherwise they're pretty unobtrusive
they're pretty subtle and they honestly
look good on most people in terms of
comfort they're really not bad they're
pretty lightweight and when you put them
on your face they fit pretty snug pretty
securely there's little rubber pads on
the inside of the nose bridge so they're
pretty comfortable sitting on your face
and they don't really weigh you down
they're not too heavy the only thing I
would say is that the hinges which is
where all the camera technology is are
pretty obtrusive so they're kind of
right in your line of sight
I'm a fashion stand boy I am honestly
pretty impressed by them I would
definitely wear them in public which i
think is a good sign I think that
they're probably best for situations
where you're outdoors maybe you're
somewhere like a sports game or on a
vacation somewhere where you're going to
be seeing a lot doing a lot otherwise
wearing them indoors you might look a
little bit nerdy they are sunglasses
after all but otherwise I think that
they look pretty good they look pretty
fashion-forward for something that is
technically a tech device so you put
them on your face you pair them with the
snap code on your phone and you're
pretty much ready to go after that ready
to start recording at that point you can
take 10 second videos all you have to do
is press this button and right at the

you don't have to do anything else in
terms of charging them it's really easy
to get the glasses at full capacity
again you stick them in the case that
they came in which in itself charges
them if the case turns out of battery
snapchat includes a little charging
cable that you can plug in has a USB on
the end you can plug it into any USB
port the glasses themselves last for a
decent decent amount of time but not too
long so you're definitely going to need
to charge them pretty often I've been
using
having use so the spectacles aren't
available everywhere just yet snapchats
keeping it pretty tight to the vest in

and unfortunately if you're thinking
